snippet: A dream to take part in an American rite of passage came true for girls whose faith forbids them to date or dance with boys.
abstract: Hamtramck High School in Michigan holds its first all-girl prom, which conforms to Muslim religious beliefs forbidding dating, dancing with boys or appearing without a head scarf in front of males; survey found 65 percent of girls at the school were not able to attend the coed prom because of cultural and religious beliefs, so the school supported the student-driven alternative.
lead_paragraph: A dream to take part in an American rite of passage came true for girls whose faith forbids them to date or dance with boys.

headline.main: This Prom Has Everything, Except for Boys
headline.print_headline: Michigan School’s Alternative Prom Has Everything Except the Boys
